titleStmt.title: Robert Neal and Louis Masey to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2353

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Foster Ky
October 27th 1860
Govenor Mcgoffin Dear sir

The commissioners previously apointed by the Board of Trustees personally appeared before me clerk of the Board of Trustees and testifyed to the following result Jesse Gray was unanimously elected ^Police Judge of the Town of Foster^ you will pleas send on his commission and oblige many citizens

Robt Neal clk
Louis Masey chair
County of Bracken and State of Kentucky sct

personally appeared before me Jas. W. Kendall one of the Commonwealthes Justices of the peace for said County Robert Neal and made oath that the above statement is correct Given under my hand this 30th day of October 1860
Jas W Kendall J P B C

Foster
Police Judge
Jesse Gray
Com Issd Nov 8 1860
